your baby’s movements. Do 
not rely on any home kits you 
may have for listening to your 
baby’s heartbeat.
You must contact your local 
maternity unit immediately. You 
must not wait until the next day 
to seek help.
You will be asked about your 
baby’s movements. You will 
have a full antenatal check-up, 
including checking your baby’s 
heartbeat.
Your baby’s heart rate will be 
monitored, usually for at least 
20 minutes. This should give you 
reassurance about your baby’s
